sen.j: 松平 信吉（まつだいら のぶよし、天正8年（1580年）－元和 (日本)6年8月1日_(旧暦)（1620年8月28日））は、安土桃山時代・江戸時代初期の人物。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi MATSUDAIRA (born in 1580 and died on August 28, 1620) was a person in the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the early Edo period.
Nobuyoshi MATSUDAIRA (1580 - August 28, 1620) was a person in the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: 原文に使われている「-」を生かすべきだと思います。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi MATSUDAIRA (1580 - August 28, 1620) was a person in the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the early Edo period.

sen.j: 藤井松平家当主で嫡流2代。
sen.e: He was the head of the Fujii Matsudaira family and the second descendant of the main branch of the family.
He was the head of the Fujii Matsudaira family and the second descendant of the main branch of the family.
He was the head of the Fujii Matsudaira family and the second descendant of the main branch of the family.

sen.j: 常陸国土浦藩・上野国高崎藩・丹波国篠山藩。
sen.e: The Tsuchiura Domain of Hitachi Province, the Takasaki Domain of Kozuke Province and the Sasayama Domain of Tanba Province.
The Tsuchiura Domain of Hitachi Province, the Takasaki Domain of Kozuke Province and the Sasayama Domain of Tanba Province.
The Tsuchiura Domain of Hitachi Province, the Takasaki Domain of Kozuke Province and the Sasayama Domain of Tanba Province.

sen.j: 幼名は万千代、後に勘四郎。
sen.e: His childhood name was Manchiyo and later, Shiro.
His childhood name was Manchiyo and later, Kanshiro.
sen.cmt: スペルミスがあります。
sen.e: His childhood name was Manchiyo and later, Kanshiro.

sen.j: なお、生年については天正3年（1575年）説もあるが、同年当時に生母・多劫姫は桜井松平忠正（父・忠吉の実兄）の正室であった時期にあたる。
sen.e: It is estimated that the year of his birth was 1575, but around this time, his real mother, Takehime was a lawful wife of Tadamasa SAKURAI MATSUDAIRA (the real elder brother of his father, Tadayoshi).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is estimated that the year of his birth was 1575, but around this time, his real mother, Takehime was a lawful wife of Tadamasa SAKURAI MATSUDAIRA (the real elder brother of his father, Tadayoshi).

It is estimated that the year of his birth was 1575, but around this time, his real mother, Takehime was a lawful wife of Tadamasa SAKURAI MATSUDAIRA (the real elder brother of his father, Tadayoshi).

sen.j: ゆえに、この説は辻褄が合わない。
sen.e: So, there is contradiction in this assumption.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: So, there is contradiction in this assumption.
So, there is contradiction in this assumption.

sen.j: 実父は桜井松平家の松平忠吉_(桜井松平家)。
sen.e: His real father was Tadayoshi MATSUDAIRA of the Sakurai Matsudaira clan.
sen.cmt: (桜井松平家)は重複するので省略しました。
sen.e: His real father was Tadayoshi MATSUDAIRA of the Sakurai Matsudaira clan.
His real father was Tadayoshi MATSUDAIRA of the Sakurai Matsudaira clan.

sen.j: 母は久松俊勝の娘で徳川家康の異父妹にあたる多劫姫。
sen.e: His mother was Takehime, who was a daughter of Toshikatsu HISAMATSU and a half younger sister with the same mother of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
His mother was Takehime, who was a daughter of Toshikatsu HISAMATSU and a half younger sister with the same mother of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
His mother was Takehime, who was a daughter of Toshikatsu HISAMATSU and a half younger sister with the same mother of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 忠吉の長男にあたる。
sen.e: He was the first son of Tadayoshi.
He was the first son of Tadayoshi.
He was the first son of Tadayoshi.

sen.j: 養父は藤井松平信一で正室は信一の娘（養女で阿部定吉の娘とも）。
sen.e: His foster father was Nobukazu FUJII-MATSUDAIRA and his lawful wife was a daughter of Nobukazu (adopted daughter and a real daughter of Sadakichi ABE).
His foster father was Nobukazu FUJII-MATSUDAIRA and his lawful wife was a daughter of Nobukazu (adopted daughter and a real daughter of Sadakichi ABE).
His foster father was Nobukazu FUJII-MATSUDAIRA and his lawful wife was a daughter of Nobukazu (adopted daughter and a real daughter of Sadakichi ABE).

sen.j: 継室は四辻秀継の娘。
sen.e: His second wife was a daughter of Hidetsugu YOTSUTSUJI.
His second wife was a daughter of Hidetsugu YOTSUTSUJI.
His second wife was a daughter of Hidetsugu YOTSUTSUJI.

sen.j: 子は松平忠国 (播磨国明石藩主)（長男）、松平忠晴（次男）、松平忠秋（三男）、松平信治（四男）、松平季治（五男）、娘（秋田俊季正室）。
sen.e: His children included Tadakuni MATSUDAIRA (the fist son, and the lord of Akashi Domain in Harima Province), Tadaharu MATSUDAIRA (the second son), Tadaaki MATSUDAIRA (the third son), Nobuharu MATSUDAIRA (the forth son), Sueharu MATSUDAIRA (the fifth son) and a daughter (a lawful wife of Toshisue Akita).

His children included Tadakuni MATSUDAIRA (the fist son, and the lord of Akashi Domain in Harima Province), Tadaharu MATSUDAIRA (the second son), Tadaaki MATSUDAIRA (the third son), Nobuharu MATSUDAIRA (the forth son), Sueharu MATSUDAIRA (the fifth son) and a daughter (a lawful wife of Toshisue Akita).

His children included Tadakuni MATSUDAIRA (the fist son, and the lord of Akashi Domain in Harima Province), Tadaharu MATSUDAIRA (the second son), Tadaaki MATSUDAIRA (the third son), Nobuharu MATSUDAIRA (the forth son), Sueharu MATSUDAIRA (the fifth son) and a daughter (a lawful wife of Toshisue Akita).

sen.j: 弟に桜井松平家を継いだ松平忠頼がいる。
sen.e: Tadayori MATSUDAIRA was his brother who succeeded to the Sakurai Matsudaira clan.
Tadayori MATSUDAIRA was his brother who succeeded to the Sakurai Matsudaira clan.
Tadayori MATSUDAIRA was his brother who succeeded to the Sakurai Matsudaira clan.

sen.j: 長男・忠国の家系は山城国守を世襲し、次男・忠晴の家系は、伊賀国守を世襲。
sen.e: The family line of the first son, Tadakuni inherited Yamashiro no kuni no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province) and the family line of the second son, Tadaharu inherited Iga no kuni no kami (Governor of Iga Province).

The family line of the first son, Tadakuni inherited Yamashiro no kuni no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province) and the family line of the second son, Tadaharu inherited Iga no kuni no kami (Governor of Iga Province).

The family line of the first son, Tadakuni inherited Yamashiro no kuni no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province) and the family line of the second son, Tadaharu inherited Iga no kuni no kami (Governor of Iga Province).

sen.j: このため藤井松平家は2流に分かれる事となった。
sen.e: Therefore, the Fujii-Matsudaira clan was divided into two branches.
Therefore, the Fujii-Matsudaira clan was divided into two branches.
Therefore, the Fujii-Matsudaira clan was divided into two branches.

sen.j: 伊賀守の家系は、老中を多数輩出している。
sen.e: The family line of Iga no kami produced a lot of roju (senior councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate).
The family line of Iga no kami produced a lot of roju (senior councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate).
The family line of Iga no kami produced a lot of roju (senior councillor of the Tokugawa shogunate).

sen.j: 実父は桜井松平家の当主ではあるが、その実兄である先代・忠正が没し、その遺児松平家広（生母は信吉と同じ多劫姫であるため、異父兄にもあたる）が成人するまでの中継ぎであった。
sen.e: His real father, Tadayoshi was the head of the Sakura Matsudaira clan, but he became a temporary head after Tadayoshi's real elder brother and the former head, Tadamasa died and had been in that position until Iehiro, the son of Tadamasa, turned twenty (the real mother of Iehiro was alsoTakihime, so, Iehiro and Nobuyoshi were half brothers with the same mother).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His real father, Tadayoshi was the head of the Sakura Matsudaira clan, but he became a temporary head after Tadayoshi's real elder brother and the former head, Tadamasa died and had been in that position until Iehiro, the son of Tadamasa, turned twenty (the real mother of Iehiro was alsoTakihime, so, Iehiro and Nobuyoshi were half brothers with the same mother).

His real father, Tadayoshi was the head of the Sakura Matsudaira clan, but he became a temporary head after Tadayoshi's real elder brother and the former head, Tadamasa died and had been in that position until Iehiro, the son of Tadamasa, turned twenty (the real mother of Iehiro was alsoTakihime, so, Iehiro and Nobuyoshi were half brothers with the same mother).

sen.j: その父も天正10年（1582年）には死亡している。
sen.e: And then, his father died in 1582.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And then, his father died in 1582.
And then, his father died in 1582.

sen.j: 更に母もその後保科正直と再婚しているため、不遇な少年時代を過ごした。
sen.e: Additionally, later, his mother remarried Masanao HOSHINA, so he spent an unhappy boyhood.
Additionally, later, his mother remarried Masanao HOSHINA, so he spent an unhappy boyhood.
Additionally, later, his mother remarried Masanao HOSHINA, so he spent an unhappy boyhood.

sen.j: ところが、同じ松平氏一族の藤井松平家の松平信一が子供に恵まれなかったために、主君・徳川家康の甥にあたる信吉が養子に迎えられる事になった。
sen.e: However, Nobukazu MATSUDAIRA of the Fujii-Matsudaira family which was the same family line as the Matsudaira clan had no child, so Nobuyoshi, who was a nephew of the lord, Ieysu TOKUGAWA was adopted into the Fujii-Matsudaira family.

However, Nobukazu MATSUDAIRA of the Fujii-Matsudaira family which was the same family line as the Matsudaira clan had no child, so Nobuyoshi, who was a nephew of the lord, Ieysu TOKUGAWA was adopted into the Fujii-Matsudaira family.

However, Nobukazu MATSUDAIRA of the Fujii-Matsudaira family which was the same family line as the Matsudaira clan had no child, so Nobuyoshi, who was a nephew of the lord, Ieysu TOKUGAWA was adopted into the Fujii-Matsudaira family.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦い後の慶長6年（1601年）、養父・信一は結城秀康の越前国移封に伴ってその支城であった土浦城4万石に封じられた。
sen.e: After the Battle of Sekigahara, in 1601, his foster father. Nobukazu received Tsuchiura Castle of forty thousands Goku crop yields which was the branch castle of Echizen Province, when Hideyasu YUKI was transferred to Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Battle of Sekigahara, in 1601, his foster father. Nobukazu received Tsuchiura Castle of forty thousands Goku crop yields which was the branch castle of Echizen Province, when Hideyasu YUKI was transferred to Echizen Province.

After the Battle of Sekigahara in 1601, his foster father, Nobukazu received Tsuchiura Castle of forty thousands Goku crop yields which was the branch castle of Echizen Province, when Hideyasu YUKI was transferred to Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: カンマに変更しました。

sen.j: 続いて翌年には江戸崎藩の蘆名盛重が実家の佐竹氏に連座して出羽国角館城に移された。
sen.e: In the following year, Morishige Ashina of the Edosaki Domain was transferred to Kakunodate Castle in Dewa Province, because he was implicated in a plot conceived by his parental home, the Satake clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the following year, Morishige ASHINA of the Edosaki Domain was transferred to Kakunodate Castle in Dewa Province, because he was implicated in a plot conceived by his parental home, the Satake clan.
sen.cmt: 人名の表記が翻訳仕様指示書に指示されている表記形式と違います。
sen.e: In the following year, Morishige ASHINA of the Edosaki Domain was transferred to Kakunodate Castle in Dewa Province, because he was implicated in a plot conceived by his parental home, the Satake clan.

sen.j: そのため、信吉は養父の名代として江戸崎藩の事後処理にあたった。
sen.e: Therefore, Nobuyoshi dealt with the aftermath of the Edosaki Domain as a representative of his foster father.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, Nobuyoshi dealt with the aftermath of the Edosaki Domain as a representative of his foster father.
Therefore, Nobuyoshi dealt with the aftermath of the Edosaki Domain as a representative of his foster father.

sen.j: 慶長8年（1603年）には安房国守に叙任される。
sen.e: In 1603, he became Awano kuni no kami (Governor of Awa Province).
In 1603, he became Awano kuni no kami (Governor of Awa Province).
In 1603, he became Awano kuni no kami (Governor of Awa Province).

sen.j: この年に養父が隠居して翌年に家督相続が認められて土浦藩主となる。
sen.e: In this year, his foster father retired and the next year, his succession to the family was approved and he became the lord of Tsuchiura Domain.
In this year, his foster father retired and the next year, his succession to the family was approved and he became the lord of Tsuchiura Domain.
In this year, his foster father retired and the next year, his succession to the family was approved and he became the lord of Tsuchiura Domain.

sen.j: 土浦城を改築して水戸街道を城下に引き入れるなど領内整備を行った。
sen.e: He kept his territory in good condition refurbishing Tsuchiura Castle, pulling Mito-Kiado Road into the castle town.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He kept his territory in good condition refurbishing Tsuchiura Castle, pulling Mito-Kiado Road into the castle town.
He kept his territory in good condition refurbishing Tsuchiura Castle, pulling Mito-Kiado Road into the castle town.

sen.j: また、これと並行して2度の大坂の陣にも嫡男・忠国とともに出陣している。
sen.e: He also joined Osaka no jin (the Siege of Osaka) twice with his legitimate son, Tadakuni.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He also joined Osaka no jin (the Siege of Osaka) twice with his legitimate son, Tadakuni.
He also joined Osaka no jin (the Siege of Osaka) twice with his legitimate son, Tadakuni.

sen.j: だが、元和3年8月（1617年）に5万石をもって高崎城に転封され、続いて翌々年の元和5年（1619年）10月には更に篠山城に移されて伊豆守に転じる。
sen.e: However, in August, 1617, he was transferred to Takasaki Castle with fifty thousand Goku, and two years later, in October 1619, he was transferred to Shinoyama Castle and became Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province).

However, in August, 1617, he was transferred to Takasaki Castle with fifty thousand Goku, and two years later, in October 1619, he was transferred to Shinoyama Castle and became Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province).

However, in August, 1617, he was transferred to Takasaki Castle with fifty thousand Goku, and two years later, in October 1619, he was transferred to Shinoyama Castle and became Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province).

sen.j: こうした度重なる転封によって元々病弱であった信吉は体調を崩し、篠山移封の翌年に京都の藩邸にて病死した。
sen.e: With these several transfers, Nobuyoshi, who had a weak constitution, became ill and died in his residence in Kyoto in the next year of being transferred to Shinoyama.
With these several transfers, Nobuyoshi, who had a weak constitution, became ill and died in his residence in Kyoto in the next year of being transferred to Shinoyama.
With these several transfers, Nobuyoshi, who had a weak constitution, became ill and died in his residence in Kyoto in the next year of being transferred to Shinoyama.

sen.j: 戒名、光照院殿雲誉団惣沢大禅定門。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist names) was Koshoinden unyodansosawa daizenjomon.
sen.cmt: 光照院殿雲誉団惣沢大禅定門の読み方不明のため、「Koshoinden unyodansosawa daizenjomon.」としました。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist names) was Koshoinden unyodansosawa daizenjomon.
His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist names) was Koshoinden unyodansosawa daizenjomon.

sen.j: 墓所は、京都千本称念寺。
sen.e: His grave was in Senbon Shonen-ji Temple in Kyoto.
His grave was in Senbon Shonen-ji Temple in Kyoto.
His grave was in Senbon Shonen-ji Temple in Kyoto.
